elementalcraft.landing: $(thing)ElementalCraft$() is a magic mod based around the 4 $(thing)elements$(): $(thing)fire$(), $(thing)water$(), $(thing)earth$() and $(thing)air$().
elementalcraft.category.instruments.desc: $(thing)Instruments$() are the main crafting tools in $(thing)ElementalCraft$().$(br)They consume $(thing)elements$() and require to be on top of a $(ec:tank)Container$().
elementalcraft.category.crafting.desc: Here is everything you need to know about $(thing)Crafting$().
elementalcraft.category.shrines.desc: $(thing)Shrines$() are powerfull tools that canalyse $(thing)elements$() in the world around them to act on it.
elementalcraft.page.source0: $(thing)Sources$() are naturaly occuring spots where $(thing)elements$() converge.$(br2)It's strangly recomended to explore a bit and find $(thing)sources$() at least one for each $(thing)element$().$(br)It is also recomended to mark their spot to find them back easyer when you need them.
elementalcraft.page.inertcrystal0: To get $(item)Inert Crystal$() start digging underground and mine $(item)Inert Crystal Ore$().
elementalcraft.page.containedcrystal0: $(item)Contained Crystals$() are the main components of $(thing)instruments$().$(br)By coating an $(item)Inert Crystal$() with $(thing)gold$() you are able to preven it to get altered by $(thing)elements$() without lousing its ability to interact with them.
elementalcraft.page.elementpipe0: $(item)Pipes$() are used to transport $(thing)elements$() across distance, their main use is to provide $(thing)instruments$() with the required $(thing)element$().$(br2)you can conficure a $(item)pipe$() by right clicking a section or the core to change it from $(thing)connected$(), $(thing)disconected$(), $(thing)insert$() or $(thing)extract$().
elementalcraft.page.whiterock0: $(item)Whiterock$() is $(thing)earth infused$() $(item)stone$().$(br)It is used in the crafting of advanced $(thing)instruments$() and $(thing)shrines$().$(br)To get it simply put $(item)stone$(). in an $(ec:infuser).
elementalcraft.page.tank0: The $(item)Element Container$() is a an advanced $(thing)element$() storage, it can store more $(thing)elements$() than the $(ec:tank_small)Small Container$() and is compatible with all $(thing)instruments$().
elementalcraft.page.extractor0: Use an $(item)Extractor$() to extract $(thing)elements$() form $(ec:source)sources$().$(br2)To do so place the $(item)Extractor$() above a $(ec:tank)Container$() and below the $(ec:source)source$() you want to extract.
elementalcraft.page.infuser0: Now that you can extract $(thing)elements$() it's time to infuse it.$(br2)To do so you need an $(item)Infuser$() and put it on top of a $(ec:tank)Container$().$(br)D'ont forget to connect it to the $(ec:extractor)Extractor$()'s $(ec:tank)Container$() with a $(ec:pipe)pipe$().
elementalcraft.page.infusion0: To infuse an item simply right click the $(ec:infuser)Infuser$() while holding the item you want to infuse.$(br)Try it now with an $(item)Inert Crystal$().
elementalcraft.page.tank_small0: The $(item)Small Element Container$() is a simple $(thing)element$() storage, it can $(thing)elements$() provide to $(thing)instruments$().$(br2)All $(thing)instruments$() need to be placed on top of a $(item)Container$() to operate.$(br)The $(item)Small Element Container$() can only work with $(ec:extractor)Extractors$() and $(ec:infuser)Infusers$().$(br)You can alos transer $(thing)elements$() from one $(item)Container$() to another using $(ec:pipe)pipes$().
elementalcraft.page.binder0: The $(item)Binder$() is one of the most important $(thing)Instrument$(), it allows to canalyse $(thing)elements$() to combine muntiples items together.$(br)Be carefull because the order in witch you put the Items is important.$(br)As for any other $(thing)Instruments$(), the $(item)Binder$() needs to be on top of a $(ec:tank)Container$(). but not a $(ec:tank_small)Small Container$().
elementalcraft.page.shrinebase0: This is the building block of all $(thing)shrines$().
